react
Class AbstractValue<T>

java.lang.Object
  react.Reactor<ValueView.Listener<T>>
      react.AbstractValue<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
ValueView<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Value
public abstract class AbstractValue<T>
extends Reactor<ValueView.Listener<T>>
implements ValueView<T>

Handles the machinery of connecting listeners to a value and notifying them, without exposing a public interface for updating the value. This can be used by libraries which wish to provide observable values, but must manage the maintenance and distribution of value updates themselves (so that they may send them over the network, for example).

Method Detail

map

public <M> ValueView<M> map(Function<? super T,M> func)
Description copied from interface: ValueView
Creates a value that maps this value via a function. When this value changes, the mapped listeners will be notified, regardless of whether the new and old mapped values differ. The mapped value will retain a connection to this value for as long as it has connections of its own.

Specified by:
map in interface ValueView<T>

connect

public Connection connect(ValueView.Listener<? super T> listener)
Description copied from interface: ValueView
Connects the supplied listener to this value, such that it will be notified when this value changes.

Specified by:
connect in interface ValueView<T>
Returns:
a connection instance which can be used to cancel the connection.

connectNotify

public Connection connectNotify(ValueView.Listener<? super T> listener)
Description copied from interface: ValueView
Connects the supplied listener to this value, such that it will be notified when this value changes. Also immediately notifies the listener of the current value. Note that the previous value supplied with this notification will be null. If the notification triggers an unchecked exception, the slot will automatically be disconnected and the caller need not worry about cleaning up after itself.

Specified by:
connectNotify in interface ValueView<T>
Returns:
a connection instance which can be used to cancel the connection.

disconnect

public void disconnect(ValueView.Listener<? super T> listener)
Description copied from interface: ValueView
Disconnects the supplied listener from this value if it's connected. If the listener has been connected multiple times, all connections are cancelled.

Specified by:
disconnect in interface ValueView<T>
